org.tal.redstonechips.channel
Class WirelessCircuit

java.lang.Object
  org.tal.redstonechips.circuit.Circuit
      org.tal.redstonechips.channel.WirelessCircuit
Direct Known Subclasses:
ReceivingCircuit, TransmittingCircuit
public abstract class WirelessCircuit
extends Circuit

Represents a circuit that can either transmit or receive wireless messages.

Author:
Tal Eisenberg

setStartBit

public void setStartBit(int startBit)
Sets the 1st channel bit used by this circuit.

Parameters:
startBit - Bit index.

initWireless

protected void initWireless(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender,
                            String channelString)
                     throws IllegalArgumentException
Parses the channel string and registers the chip as a wireless circuit.

Parameters:
sender - The chip creator.
channelString - The channel and optionally the starting bit to communicate on. Format: channel-name[:start-bit]
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - when channelString is invalid or the creator doesn't have channel permissions.
